html_input: Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that they will actually pay me six months from now.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Whatever amount I save and the interest it accrues will be paid out to me six months from now.
Whatever amount I save will be paid out to me six months from now, but I will not receive interest payments.
Whatever amount I save and the interest it accrues may be paid out to me six months from now, but there is a 40% chance that the study leaders won’t actually send me the money.
Which one of the following statements is true?
If I save 50 points and the interest rate is 10%, then I will receive 55 points in six months: 50 points that I saved and 5 points in interest payments.
If I save 50 points and the interest rate is 10%, then I will receive 5 points in six months.
If I save 50 points and the interest rate is 10%, then I will receive 50 points in six months.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the points I sent will actually be received by the other participant
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I chose the option that actually maximizes my own payoff.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The more points I send to the other participant, the lower my bonus is for sure, and the higher the other participant’s bonus is with some percentage chance.
The more points I send to the other participant, the higher my bonus is for sure, and the lower the other participant’s bonus is for sure.
The more points I send to the other participant, the lower my bonus is for sure, and the higher the other participant’s bonus is for sure.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Every point I keep increases my bonus by $0.10.
Every point I keep decreases my bonus by $0.10.
Every point I keep increases my bonus by $0.01.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my decision actually reflects how much I value the hint.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am about the outcome of the coin flip.
Which one of the following statements is NOT true?
Depending on the accuracy rate of the hint, the hint could be more likely to be incorrect than correct.
If the hint says that the coin came up Heads and the accuracy rate of the hint is 100%, it is certain that the coin actually came up Heads. If I follow the hint, my guess is guaranteed to be correct.

If the hint says that the coin came up Heads and the accuracy rate of the hint is 50%, the hint is equally likely to be right and wrong. Following the hint will be no better than if I guessed randomly.
Which one of the following statements is true?
If a round in this study is selected for payment, I am more likely to receive the hint if I stated a higher willingness to pay for the hint in that round.
If a round in this study is selected for payment, whether or not I receive the hint does not depend on my stated willingness to pay for the hint in that round.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I took is actually the decision that maximizes my bonus.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that they will actually pay me my bonus.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The happiness gain from consuming 10 instead of 9 bottles of milk is smaller than the happiness gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 bottle.
The happiness gain from consuming 10 instead of 9 bottles of milk is larger than the happiness gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 bottle.
The happiness gain from consuming 10 instead of 9 bottles of milk is exactly as large as the happiness gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 bottle.
Suppose the price of milk is higher than the price of juice. Which one of the following statements is correct?
The happinesses-maximizing answer involves less milk than juice because I get less milk than juice for the same money.
The happinesses-maximizing answer involves more milk than juice because I get less milk than juice for the same money.
The happinesses-maximizing answer involves less milk than juice because I get more milk than juice for the same money.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my investment decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my investment decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I will actually paid for my returns in one year.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my investment decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am in my estimate of the return of the stock account.
Suppose you invest $500 in both the Stock Account and the Bank Account. Which of the following statements is true?
My payment in one year will depend on the returns of both the Stock Account and the Bank Account.
My payment in one year will depend only on the return of the Stock Account.
My payment in one year will depend only on the return of the Bank Account.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Because the Stock Account tracks an ETF (a basket of stocks and other securities), its return may be higher or lower than the return of the Bank Account.
The Stock Account will always deliver a higher return than the return of the Bank Account.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences  and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I chose the option that actually maximizes my own payoff.
Which one of the following statements is true?
My decision determines the row in the payoff matrix determining our payoffs.
My decision determines the column in the payoff matrix determining our payoffs.
Whatever amount I invest into the investment fund gets split equally between stocks A and B.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The first (blue) number in the matrix cell corresponding to our action choices determines my payment, the second (red) number determines the other player's  payment.
The first (blue) number in the matrix cell corresponding to our action choices determines both my and the other player's payment.
The second (red) number in the matrix cell corresponding to our action choices determines both my and the other player's payment.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The different rounds in this study are independent of each other and I should make my decision in each round independently of all other rounds.
The different rounds in this study depend on each other, hence my decisions in later rounds should factor in how I decided in earlier rounds.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Out of whatever amount I invest into the investment fund, 95% gets allocated to stock A and 5% to stock B.
Whatever amount I invest into the investment fund gets allocated to stock B.
Whatever amount I invest into the investment fund gets split equally between stocks A and B.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Stock A always has a 70% chance of doubling the investment but for Stock B this probability varies across rounds.
Stock A and Stock B both always have a 70% chance of doubling the investment.
Stock B always has a 10% of doubling the investment but for Stock A this probability varies across rounds.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my decisions actually reflect how much I value the reduction in CO2 emissions.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my choices will actually lead to reduction in CO2 emissions through the purchase of carbon offsets.
Suppose the third row from the top gets randomly selected to determine the outcomes of this experiment. Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
I will get $3.
I will get $0.
The researchers will purchase 2.25 tons emissions.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I should complete the choice lists by thinking carefully about the row in which I would like to switch from reducing carbon emission to receiving money.
I should always switch in the first row of the choice list so that I get the highest possible bonus.
I should always switch in the last row of the choice list.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my forecast of the firm’s earnings is statistically correct, given the available information.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how predictable I think the firm’s earnings will be.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The unpredictable change is a random draw from the numbers between -8 and +8, with each number equally likely to be drawn.
The unpredictable change is a random draw from the numbers between -8 and +8, with positive numbers more likely to be drawn than negative numbers.
Which one of the following statements is true?
My task is to forecast the 2024 earnings of the firm, which is equal to the firm’s 2023 earnings plus the change in earnings between 2023 and 2024.
My task is to forecast the 2023 earnings change of the firm.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I chose the option that actually maximizes my own payoff.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Every point I spend to help decreases the chances the other people in my group lose their bonus point by one percentage point.
Every point I spend to help increases the chances the other people in my group lose their bonus points by one percentage point.
Every point I spend to help decreases the chances the other people in my group lose their bonus point by two percentage points.
Imagine there are 5 other participants in your group. Suppose you spend 40 points to help. Then by how much does the chance that these five other participants lose their bonus points decrease?
The chance that all other participants lose their bonus decreases by 40 percentage points.
The chance that one of the other participants loses their bonus decreases by 40 percentage points, and for the other participants it remains unaffected.
The chance that I lose my bonus decreases by 40 percentage points.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my decisions actually reflect how much more I would be willing to pay to lease the Camry Hybrid.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the Camry Hybrid is a better choice.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The vehicles that I need to choose between are the same across each round. However, the miles I expect to drive annually will change across the scenarios each round.
The vehicles that I need to choose between vary across the scenarios in each round.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The Camry Hybrid is more expensive to lease but - depending on how much I drive - potentially produces savings because it uses less fuel per mile.
The Camry Hybrid is more expensive to lease and - depending on how much I drive - potentially produces additional costs because it uses more fuel per mile.
The Camry Hybrid is less expensive to lease and - depending on how much I drive - potentially produces additional savings because it uses less fuel per mile.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I have to work and receive the corresponding wage.
Which one of the following statements is NOT true?

To complete a task, I need to count the number of times a 1 occurs in a table, and my guess has to be no further than 5 from the true number. If my guess is further away from the true number, a new task will be generated.
To complete a task, I need to count the number of times a 1 occurs in a table. If I fail to count correctly, a new task will be generated.
If the wage is $0.00, I will not receive any payment for completing all tasks.
Below is an example of a counting task. To show us that you understand and can perform the task, please select the the answer corresponding to the number of 1s in the table:
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the study leaders are interested in how certain I am that water will be added rather than removed in the second season.
Which one of the following statements is true?
In terms of having a high expected total crop yield, it is more important to allocate water to the Summer when the potential weather shock is large.
In terms of having a high expected total crop yield, it is more important to allocate water to the Summer when the potential weather shock is small.
Which one of the following statements is true?

Because the crop yield increase from additional water in the Spring gets smaller and smaller the more water is already allocated to the Spring, it can make sense to allocate water to the Summer even though the yield from the Summer only increases my total crop yield with a weight of 90%.

Because the crop yield increase from additional water in the Spring gets smaller and smaller the more water is already allocated to the Spring, it never makes sense to allocate water to the Summer, because the yield from the Summer only increases my total crop yield with a weight of 90%.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I will actually receive the money from the lottery.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The percentage chances of a win and a loss are the same across all rounds, 50% for each.
The percentage chances of a win and a loss vary across rounds.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I can find out whether the lottery delivers a gain or a loss. If 31 equations are correct, it is a gain. If 29 equations are correct, it is a loss.
I can find out whether the lottery delivers a gain or a loss. If all equations are correct, it is a gain, otherwise it is a loss.
I cannot find out whether the lottery delivers a gain or a loss.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I chose the option that actually maximizes my own payoff.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The higher the percentage chance that the winner was selected based on the coin flip, the higher the chance the declared winner is determined by random luck.
The higher the percentage chance that the winner was selected based on the coin flip, the lower the chance the declared winner is determined by random luck.
The percentage chance that the winner was selected based on the coin flip has no impact on whether the declared winner is determined by random luck.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I do not know for sure who actually performed better in the contest.
The more points I transfer, the more points go to the person who actually performed better in the contest.
The more points I transfer, the less points go to the person who actually performed better in the contest.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my estimate of the percentage chance that Bag A was selected is statistically correct.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that Bag A was selected.
Which one of the following statements is true?
If the computer draws a card with “R” on it from the deck of cards, it will draw a ball from Bag R and show it to me.
If the computer draws a card with “R” on it from the deck of cards, it will draw a ball from a randomly selected bag and show it to me.
Which one of the following statements is NOT true?
If both bags contain the same number of red and blue balls, it is more likely a red ball will be drawn if Bag R was selected, compared to if Bag B was selected.
If both bags contain the same number of red and blue balls, then the likelihood a red ball will be drawn does not depend on whether Bag R or Bag B was selected.
If Bag R contains only red balls and Bag B contains only blue balls, then a red ball will be drawn only if Bag R was selected.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I took the decision that actually reflects my preferences.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that A will win the election.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The outcome of the election matters for my earnings (No taxes if A wins, taxes of $8 if B wins) regardless of whether or not I choose to submit a vote.
The outcome of the election matters for my earnings (No taxes if A wins, taxes of $8 if B wins) only if I submit a vote.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I pay the $1 price for voting, regardless of which option wins.
I pay the $1 price for voting only if A wins.
I pay the $1 price for voting only if B wins.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I gave the best possible estimate of the investment quality, given the available information.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the other participant truthfully reported the investment quality.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I Reveal, my customer will see the actual investment quality. When I Hide, they won’t get any additional information, but they will be told that I had the chance to Reveal.
When I decide to Reveal, I can report a different number than the true investment quality.
When I Hide, my customer won’t know that I had the opportunity to reveal the investment quality to them.
Which one of the following statements is true?
My customer knows that my earnings are determined differently from theirs. I get paid more for a higher guess, but they get paid more for a more accurate guess.
My customer knows that their earnings are determined in the same way as mine: we both get paid more the more accurate their guess.
My customer knows that their earnings are determined in the same way as mine: we both get paid more for a higher guess.
Which one of the following statements is true for the first section?
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my estimate of the company’s stock price is correct.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the company’s stock price is higher than 100.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I will be given 100 pieces of news about a company and my task is to estimate the current stock price based on this news.
I will be given 100 pieces of news about a company and my task is to guess the next pieces of news about the company.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The stock price is affected by both the number of positive and negative news.
The stock price is only affected by the number of negative news.
The stock price is only affected by the number of positive news.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the minimum value I chose is the one that will lead to the highest possible bonus.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the computer will ever draw a number as large as the minimum value I set.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The computer will return the poker chip to the bag before it draws another one.
The computer will not return the poker chip to the bag before it draws another one.
Which one of the following statements is NOT true?
If I set a higher minimum value, the overall cost on my score is lower, on average.
If I set a higher minimum value, the number on the chip that determines my base score is higher, on average.
If I set a higher minimum value, the overall cost on my score is higher, on average.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I took is actually the decision that maximizes my bonus.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that they will actually pay me my bonus.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Going from 80 hours of practice to 90 hours of practice with Horse A generates a smaller increase in Horse A’s prize money than going from 10 hours to 20 hours.
Going from 80 hours of practice to 90 hours of practice with Horse A generates the same increase in Horse A’s prize money as going from 10 hours to 20 hours.
Going from 80 hours of practice to 90 hours of practice with Horse A generates a larger increase in Horse A’s prize money than going from 10 hours to 20 hours.
Which one of the following statements is true?

Even if I receive a larger share of Horse A's prize money than of B's, practicing with Horse B can make sense. This is because if I already practice a lot with A, additional practice only generates relatively small increases in A's prize money.

If I earn a higher percentage of Horse A's prize money than of B's, practicing with Horse B doesn't make sense. This is because each additional hour of practice with a horse generates the same increase in prize money, regardless of how much I already practice with that horse.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I took is actually the decision that maximizes my bonus.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that they will actually pay me my bonus.
Which one of the following statements is true?
The gain in health  from consuming 10 instead of 9 gallons of the drink is smaller than the health  gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 gallon.
The gain in health  from consuming 10 instead of 9 gallons of the drink is larger than the health  gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 gallon.
The gain in health  from consuming 10 instead of 9 gallons of the drink is exactly as large as the health  gain from consuming 2 instead of 1 gallon.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Consuming more of the healthy drink always means more health, but it also means higher costs.
Consuming more of the healthy drink can sometimes lead to lower health  if the consumer already bought a lot of the drink.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I will actually receive the lottery payment of $18.
Suppose the third row from the top gets randomly selected to determine the outcomes of this experiment. Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
I will get $3.
I will get a lottery which pays $18 with 80% probability.
I will get a lottery which pays $0 with 20% probability.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I should complete the choice lists by thinking carefully about the row in which I would like to switch from preferring the lottery ticket to preferring the safe payment.
I should always switch in the first row of the choice list so that I get the highest possible bonus.
I should always switch in the last row of the choice list. This increases the chance of the lottery ticket determining my bonus and will thus maximize my bonus.
Which one of the following statements is true?

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my decisions actually reflect which winning probability I value as much as the safe payment.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I will receive the high payment from the lottery.
Suppose the third row from the top gets randomly selected to determine the outcomes of this experiment. Which one of the following statements is NOT correct?
I will get a lottery which pays $18 with 15% probability.
I will get $12.
Which one of the following statements is true?

I should always switch in the last row of the choice list so that I get the highest possible bonus.
I should always switch in the first row of the choice list. This increases the chance of the lottery determining my bonus and will thus maximize my bonus.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I would actually receive the delayed payments.
Which one of the following statements is true?
In making my decisions, I am asked to assume that I will actually receive all payments as indicated, regardless of whether they take place now or in the future.
In making my decisions, I am asked to assume that it is less likely that I will actually receive payments that are meant to be received now.
In making my decisions, I am asked to assume that it is less likely that I will actually receive payments that are meant to be received in the future.
Which one of the following statements is true?
I should complete the choice lists by thinking carefully about the row in which I would like to switch from preferring the delayed payment to preferring the immediate payment.
I should always switch in the first row of the choice list so that I get the highest possible bonus.
I should always switch in the last row of the choice list so that I get the highest possible bonus.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that Ann and Bob’s estimates of the weight of the bucket are correct.

Some estimators report their estimates to Ann, and the others report to Bob. No estimator reports to both Ann and Bob.
Some estimators report their estimates to both Ann and Bob.
Which one of the following statements is true?
Ann and Bob report to you the average of the estimates they receive from the estimators.
Ann and Bob report to you their own estimates of the weight of the bucket.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am what the demand quantity will be.

I can only sell 30 gallons at a sales price of $12, and need to pay the production costs for 40 gallons. The remaining gallons go to waste.
I can sell 40 gallons at a sales price of $12, and need to pay the production costs for 40 gallons.

I can sell 40 gallons at a sales price of $12, and need to pay the production costs only for these 40 gallons.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that they will actually pay me my bonus.

My bonus is higher the closer my answer is to the correct answer.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that Stock A will deliver a profit.

Whatever amount I invest into the investment fund gets allocated to Stock B.
Whatever amount I invest into the investment fund gets split equally between Stocks A and B.

Stock A and Stock B both always have a 80% chance of doubling the investment.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I chose the option that actually maximizes my own payoff.

If I decide to donate to the charity, the experimenters will not actually donate the specified amount to the charity.

If I decide to donate to the charity, I will pay nothing (the experimenters will pay the specified amount), but I will forego a bonus of $1.
If I decide to donate to the charity, I will have to pay that amount to the charity myself.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I made the decision that actually maximizes my own payoff.
Suppose there are 10 Payers. Remember each Payer starts out with 40 points. Which of the following statements is true?
If I award 10 points to myself, then each Payer ends up with 36 points because for each point I transfer 0.4 points get deducted from each Payer.
If I award 10 points to myself, then each Payer ends up with 40 points.
If I award 10 points to myself, then each Payer ends up with 39.6 points because they share the cost.
Which one of the following statements is true?
For every point I award to myself, 0.4 points will be subtracted from the points of each of the Payers but not from my points.
For every point I award to myself, 0.4 points will be subtracted from my points, but not from the points of the Payers.
For every point I award to myself, 0.4 points will be subtracted from my points and from the points of each of the Payers.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that mine is the best possible forecast, given the information I have.

When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I have as much information about the asset as a financial market analyst.
Which one of the following statements is NOT true?
I will be asked to forecast inflation.
I will be asked to forecast the value of a $100 investment into different  financial assets.
Suppose the time horizon is 9 months and the asset is a fund replicating the S&P500. Which one of the following statements is true?
I will be asked to forecast the value of a $100 investment into the fund replicating the  S&P500 over the next nine months.
I will be asked to forecast the value of a $100 investment into the fund replicating the  S&P500 over the next nine months and then annualize this number.
Which one of the following statements is true?
To maximize my bonus I have to translate as many three digit codes as possible.
If my decision is selected for the bonus payment, I win if I have translated more three digit codes than the other participant with which I am paired with.
If my decision is selected for the bonus payment, it is completely random whether I win the bonus.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my estimate of the amount of taxes Fred would have to pay is correct.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that my estimate of Fred’s after-tax salary is correct.
Which one of the following statements is true?
When Fred’s income jumps to a higher tax bracket, he pays the higher rate only on the portion of his income in that tax bracket.
When Fred’s income jumps to a higher tax bracket, he pays the higher rate on his entire income.

Below is the federal income tax schedule. Which one of the following statements is true about the federal income tax Fred would owe if his income is $60,000?
Federal Tax RateIncome Bracket
12%$0 to $20,000
18%$20,000 to $50,000
26%$50,000 to $80,000
32%$80,000 to $120,000
42%$120,000 and above

Fred would pay 12% on the $20,000 portion of his income in the first bracket, 18% on the $30,000 portion of his income in the second bracket, and 26% on the $10,000 portion of his income in the third bracket in federal taxes.
Fred would pay 18% on his income of $60,000 in federal taxes.
Fred would pay 26% on his income of $60,000 in federal taxes.

When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that I took my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I’m asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that there won’t be inflation next year.

Politicians estimate that the proposed bill is very effective at making Americans richer. However, the bill also produces inflation.
Politicians estimate that the proposed bill is very effective at making Americans richer. Moreover, the bill also produces lower prices for consumers.
Politicians estimate that the proposed bill does not make Americans richer.

In this study I will be asked how much I would at most be willing to pay for 3 packs of different products.

I should carefully think about how much of my budget of $30 I would be willing to spend on the indicated number of items of the products, imagining I would actually get any money left over and receive the products I purchase.
I should always indicate that I am willing to pay $0, because this is a hypothetical study.
I should always indicate that I am willing to pay $30, because it is not my own money.

When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that the decision I made is actually my best decision, given my personal preferences and the available information.
When I'm asked to indicate my certainty about my decision, the people running this study are interested in how certain I am that people will really get sick due to the disease.

If I decide the government should spend $100,000, this is the amount the government will spend overall, meaning the government will spend $100,000 in total.
If I decide the government should spend $100,000, this is the amount the government will spend for each of the 10 people, meaning the government will spend $1,000,000 in total.

People who get the disease will be sick for 1 month.

I need to estimate the number of dots on a single screen.

I have 10 seconds to type in my estimate.
